titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the George Michael Evica papers ARCH116
titlestmt.author: Transcribed to ArchivesSpace from word document finding aid by Tiffany Crawford in Jan. 2016, under the supervision of Sean Parke. Revised May 2017, by Sean Parke.

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Hartford Archives & Special Collections

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-07-11 11:33:35 -0400.

change.item: Revised following 2016-2017 reprocessing to reflect changes.

repository.corpname: University of Hartford Archives & Special Collections

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to all researchers. The restricted series contains records that are restricted in accordance to the archives rules concerning FERPA protected materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection may be protected by copyright law (U.S. Code: Title 17). Any use of the material which exceeds fair use requires permission from the copyright holder. Researchers are solely responsible for obtaining the proper permission(s) for their use of the material.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: George Michael Evica was an Assistant Professor (1964-1973) and Associate Professor (1973-1992) of English at the University of Hartford. He was a specialist in the study of myth. Additionally, he conducted extensive research into the assassination of John F. Kennedy over the course of many decades. He was among the early challengers of the findings of the Warren Commission. Evica questioned the official conclusions of the Warren Commission and believed that the president's death resulted from some form of conspiracy.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: An index of George Michael Evica's books and videos can be found on MDID (accessible with University username and password) at: http://mdid3.hartford.edu/explore/explore/?c=allcollections:77

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The George Michael Evica papers consist of the notes, research materials, manuscripts, and published works of George Michael Evica. The majority of the collection pertains to his research and writing on the assassination of John F. Kennedy. The papers also include Evica's research and writing on myth, literature, poetry, film studies, and theater.

p.a: University of Hartford Studies in Literature collection

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in seven series: I) JFK Subject Files, II) JFK Writing and Manuscripts, III) Personal, Literature, Theater, and Cinema Files, IV) Unfiled Materials, V) Research Publications and Associated Notes, VI) Recordings, Slideshows, and Discs, VII) Restricted.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists primarily of Evica's subject files pertaining to the assassination of President John F. Kennedy and the possible conspiracies surrounding the assassination. There are some files that do not pertain directly to JFK or his assassination, but to other incidents with alleged conspiracies.
The files contain Evica's notes, correspondence, clippings, and on occasion portions of manuscript drafts or essays regarding the topic of the file.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The files are arranged in alphabetical order.

did.unittitle: CIA - American West and Latin America
Cuba - Batista, Castro, the CIA, etc.
Equitorial Africa, Lemumba, and Nigeria - Lemumba/Belgian Congo
Equitorial Africa, Lemumba, and Nigeria - Nigeria and the Church
J. Edgar Hoover - From the Secret Files
Misc. Notes on Misc. Books - Mantik
Ruby - Witnesses - Lovefield - 1980 Ruby Witness Dies - Holbrook

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains Manuscripts, drafts, and final copies of some of Evica's work regarding the assassination of John F. Kennedy. Some shorter essays and portions of drafts may also exist in Series I. JFK Subject Files. Floppy disks of these manuscripts can also be found in Series VI: Recordings, Slideshows, and Discs.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The files are arranged in alphabetical order.

did.unittitle: Personal, Literature, Theater, and Cinema Files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These files contain the personal items and papers related to Evica's research on topics including myth, film, theatre, language, literature, poetry, erotica, history, and religion. The files consist of research notes as well as his on work. Some files may contain some notes pertaining to Evica's conspiracy research.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The files are arranged in alphabetical order.

did.unittitle: Chile - Orlando Bosch and the Cuban Exile Conspiacies

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file consists of notes and copies of scripts of several Brian De Palma and Alfred Hitchcock films. This file, or portions of this file, were likely research materials for Evica's "Blood Mysteries" project.

did.unittitle: ETC. article "Korzybski's Binding Theory" by Evica
Jim Garrison in History and Film
Theatre - MacLeish - This Music Crept by Me Upon the Waters

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of items and files that were either individual items loose within boxes or were unlabeled files, that were not clearly part of an already established file and no title could be easily established. The series contains unfiled correspondence and research notes on the JFK assassination, as well as some of his other research areas like literature.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of the published materials that Evica used for his research. Small publications, articles, and clippings can also be found in other subject files in Series I-IV.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged into three sub-series: I) Research Books, Manuscripts, and Reports, II) Research Book Notes, 3) Periodicals, Articles, Conference Proceedings, and Clippings.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: An index of George Michael Evica's books and videos can be found on MDID (accessible with University username and password) at: http://mdid3.hartford.edu/explore/explore/?c=allcollections:77

did.unittitle: Periodicals, Articles, Conference Proceedings, and Clippings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of AV and digital material in the collection. This includes slideshow presentations, sound recordings (Cassette tape and one small audio reel), and computer discs (CD-ROM and Floppy Disk). The majority of the recordings are from Evica's radio program "Assassination Journal" which aired on WWUH, the University of Hartford's radio station. The floppy disks in the collection contain drafts of Evica's manuscripts.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials in this series are restricted in accordance to the Archives' access policy concerning FERPA protected materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains student papers that were within Evica's research files.
